ygData.subject: RE: Is the verdict finally in?
ygData.msgSnippet: I think not. I play EQ a lot from different computers. Things I have to set up on each new computer are hotkeys, friends list, and ignore list. However, my
ygData.messageBody:
I think not. I play EQ a lot from different computers. Things I have to
set up on each new computer are hotkeys, friends list, and ignore list.
However, my character, equipment, bank balance, faction, current buffs,
and location remain the same.

That indicates to me that all of the second list are on the server, not
the individual computer.

-----Original Message-----
From: kale usi [mailto:kaleusi@...]
Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 7:28 AM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?


From: "kale usi" <kaleusi@...>

It's been suggested from a knowledgeable hacker, that important
information
(such as your characters banking information) is stored locally on your
hard
drive in a packed file. Has anyone else been able to unpack any files to

verify/refute this? If this is found to be true, then it looks as though
EQ
has been hacked like UO.
